Abstrak:
To evaluate an orchard code, a standard
measure of how well the orchard code works
is necessary. In the paper we propose the decoding
delay to replace the commonly used scheme length
as a criterion for evaluating orchard codes. The
ever approachable lower bound of the decoding
delay is derived to be 2T for T-error correcting
orchard codes. With the help of the concept of the
decoding delay, the performances of several
orchard codes are compared. Also given are some
very interesting new orchard codes.
Sumber: lEE PROCEEDINGS-I, Vol. 139, No.4, AUGUST i992
